MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Old-Fashioned Homemade Ice Cream
 Categories: Ice cream
      Yield: 6 quarts
 
      2 ea Eggs, beaten well
      4 tb Flour
  2 1/2 tb Vanilla
      3 c  Sugar (less for 5 qt freezer
           Milk (about 1 gallon)
 
       In saucepan, combine sugar and flour.  Stir well to break up any
  lumps.  Add 2 to 3 cups milk and eggs.  Cook, stirring constantly,
  until thick (usually until it comes to a boil).  Cool.  Add vanilla.
       Pour into freezer and add enough milk to fill freezer 2/3 to 3/4
  full. It usually takes our ice cream freezer from 25-40 minutes to
  get the ice cream done.
       This is a recipe we've used in our family since the 1950's.  I
  hope you enjoy it as much as we have!
       Typed for you by Sandi Cutright.
  Submitted By SANDI CUTRIGHT   On   07-22-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cranberry Nut Muffins
 Categories: Breads, Fruit, Muffins
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2 c  Whole Wheat Flour
    3/4 c  Sugar
  1 1/2 ts Baking Powder
    1/2 ts Salt
    1/2 ts Baking Soda
    3/4 c  Orange Juice
      1 tb Grated Orange Peel
      2 tb Shortening
      1 ea Egg; Large, Well Beaten
  1 1/2 c  Cranberries; *
      1 c  Nuts; Chopped, Optional
 
  *    Use either fresh or frozen cranberries that have been coarsely
       chopped. In a medium mixer bowl, mix the flour, sugar, baking
  powder, salt and the baking soda together. Stir in the orange juice,
  orange peel, shortening and the egg. Mix until well blended. Stir in
  the cranberries and the nuts, if used, and turn into greased muffin
  tins. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 to 25 minutes or until done. Use a
  shorter baking time if small muffin tins are used.
  Submitted By BOBBI ZEE   On   07-21-95

      Title: Consomm aux Cpes
 Categories: Main dish, Soup/stew
      Yield: 4 servings
 
   1800 ml Fond de Volaille
     20 g  Cpes Sechs
           Sel et Poivre
      4 pn Cerfeuil Hache
 
  Mettre le bouillon de volaille dans une casserole adapt et porter 
  l'bullition. Cependant, laver les cpes sechs dans une passoire
  avec de l'eau froide. Les mettre avec le bouillon, et quand il
  commence  bouillir, reduire le feu au minimum et laisser mijoter.
    Mijoter sans couvercle  peu prs une heure et demie, jusqu' ce
  que le bouillon soit rduit a 2/3. Assaisonner soigneusement, et au
  moment de servir, saupoudrer le consomm avec une pince de cerfeuil
  sur chaque assiette.

      Title: Blue Cheese Butter
 Categories: Bbq/grill, Meats, Potatoes, Cheese/eggs, Dips/spread
      Yield: 4 servings
 
    1/4 c  Butter or margarine;softened

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Salmon Burger
 Categories: Fish, Seafood
      Yield: 4 or 5 servi
 
      1 cn Alaska Pink salmon, 15 1/2
           -oz
      1    Egg*
    1/2 c  Onion, chopped
    1/2 c  Green Pepper, finely
           -chopped
    1/2 c  Fresh whole bread crumbs
      1 tb Lemon juice
      1 tb Lemon peel, grated
    1/2 ts Rosemary, crushed
    1/8 ts Pepper
 
  Choice of Toppings:
  
  :          Tomato, sliced
  :          Pickles, sliced
  :          Onion, chopped
  :          Cheese, sliced
  :          Pickle or mustard relish
  :          Catsup
  :          Mayonnaise
  :          Mustard
  :          Tartar sauce
  :          Thousand island dressing
  :          Lettuce
  
  Description:
  
  Serve salmon burgers as you would your favorite hamburger-with all the
  trimmings.
  
  Instructions:
  
  Drain salmon, reserve 2 tablespoons liquid; flake.  Combine salmon,
  egg, onion, green pepper, bread crumbs, reserved liquid, lemon juice,
  lemon peel and seasonings; mix well.  Form into 4 or 5 patties.
  Pan-fry in lightly oiled skillet about 5 minutes or until lightly
  browned; turn halfway through cooking time.  Top with choice of
  toppings.
  
  Source/Author: Alaska Seafood Marketing Institute / typo Bob Shiells
  
  Notes:
  
  Substitute egg white for whole egg for lower total fat and cholesterol
  content.
  Submitted By BOB SHIELLS   On   07-21-95

      Title: Blackberry Mint Bisque
 Categories: Beverages, Fruit, Healthy
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      4 c  Blackberries
    1/2 c  Raspberry lemonade
  1 1/2 c  Plain nonfat or soy yogurt
        x  Fresh mint; chopped
 
  PREP TIME:  5 minutes
  
  1.  Puree blackberries and lemonade in a food processor or blender.
  
  2.  Pour fruit mixture into a medium saucepan and heat on low for
  about 5 minutes to blend flavors.  Remove soup from burner and whisk
  in yogurt. Remove soup from burner and whisk in yogurt.  Chill if
  desired. Serve topped with fresh mint.
  
  PER SERVING:  172 calories; 1g fat; 5% calories from fat; 0mg
  cholesterol; 6.6g fiber.
  
  Source:  Karen Greene "Fast!  Fresh!  Fruity!" (New Hope Press) as
  seen in "Delicious!  Your Magazine of Natural Living," July 1995.
  
  Typed by iRis gRayson.
  Submitted By IRIS GRAYSON   On   07-21-95

      Title: Ken's Chili [Indx]
 Categories: Chili, Meats
      Yield: 4 servings
 
  2 1/2 lb Course grd chuck
      2 cn (8oz) tomato sauce
     24 oz Water
      2 cn Jalapeno Pinto beans
           -& @liq.*
      2 lg Onion
      2    Garlic cloves, minced
      2 ts Red pepper
    1/2 c  Chili powder
      1 ts Paprika
  1 1/2 ts Cumin
      2 ts Mesa flour
 
  INDEX CARD
  
  Saute onions and garlic in lite oil till brown. Sear meat in large
  skillet.Add tomato sauce and water. Stir in all ingredients, except
  flour and beans*. Cover skillet and simmer 1 hour. Stir occasionally.
  Stir in flour into 1/4 cup warm water to make a thick, but flow able
  mixture. Add flour mixture to chili; simmer another 15 to 20 min.*Add
  bean and juice and cook another 15 min. Best when allowed to
  refrigerate for 24 hour but who can wait?
  
  *Optional
  
  Ken Strei's favorite Chili

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Daube
 Categories: Meats, Pasta, Tomatoes
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      4 lb To 5 lb beef chuck roast
      1 tb Olive oil
    1/2 c  Chopped onion
    1/2 c  Chopped green pepper
      1    To 2 cloves garlic
      8 oz Can tomato paste
      8 oz Can tomato sauce
           Salt and pepper to taste
      4    Or 5 carrots
 
  Tried this recipe the other day.  I prefer a little more tomatoe-y
  sauce for spaghetti, but I thought the meat was divine. I omitted the
  carrots, just because I forgot them.  @:-)
  
  On the butcher's recommendation, I used a center cut chuck roast
  (which was 10 cents more a pound than blade cut).  Cut the bones off
  before cooking and have them stashed in the freezer for veggie soup
  later this winter.
  
  I made this in my cast iron Dutch oven.
  
  Sear roast in heated olive oil.  remove from pan and andd onions,
  green pepper, and garlic.  Fry until soft but now brown.  Add tomato
  paste and sauce.  Stir and cook about 5 minutes.  (MY NOTE: I've read
  elsewhere that this allows the sugar in the tomato porducts to
  crystalize, sweetening the sauce.)  Add meat, salt, and pepper. Add
  water to cover roast. Simmer about 5 hours.
  
  Thirty minutes before serving, add carrots. Serve with spaghetti.
  Shared by Ellen Cleary
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: CHEESE ENCHILADAS
 Categories: Tex/mexican, Main dish, Cheese/eggs
      Yield: 6 servings
 
     16    Corn tortillas
  1 1/2 lb Cheddar cheese, shredded
      1 bn Green onions, chopped
      4    Clove garlic, minced
    1/3 c  Oil
      2 tb Flour
      2 tb Chili powder
     19 oz Enchilada sauce
      1 ts Salt
      8 oz Tomato sauce, canned
      1 c  Water
 
  Sauce:  Saute' garlic in oil, add flour and chili powder and mix
  well. Add enchilada sauce and tomato sauce, salt and water.  Let
  simmer for 1 hour. Can be made in quantities and frozen.
  
  Enchiladas:  Fry tortillas for a second in hot oil just until soft.
  Drain and pat dry on paper towels.  Mix cheese and onion.  Put
  approximately 1 heaping Tbsp. cheese mixture on each tortilla.  Roll
  and place seam side down in large baking pan.
  
  Cover enchiladas with sauce and sprinkle with additional shredded
  cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 20-30 minutes, or until sauce is
  bubbly and cheese is melted.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: CHURROS
 Categories: Tex/mexican, Desserts, Breads
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 c  Flour, sifted
    1/8 ts Salt
    1/2 ts Cinnamon
      3    Eggs
      3 c  (about) cooking oil for
           -frying
      1 c  Water
      5 tb Butter or margarine
           Confectioner's sugar, if
           -desired
 
  "Here's a recipe from a local Mexican resturant, called Listas, that
  I use to frequent." - Anne Nicol
  
  Sift together the flour and cinnamon.  Heat oil (1 inch in depth) in
  large heavy skillet to medium-high(375 degree). In a medium heavy
  saucepan, bring water to a boil over high heat; add butter and salt,
  allowing butter to melt.  Remove from heat.  Add dry ingredients;
  mixing well with whisk. Add eggs, one at a time, whisking well.
  Spoon into a pastry or piping bag, fitted with star shaped tip.
  Squeeze batter in a straight line into hot oil, making each churro
  about 6 inches in length.  Fry until churros are golden brown, about
  3 minutes, turning occasionally.  Drain well on paper towels and sift
  confectioners' sugar over churros.  Serve warm.
  
  Posted by:  Anne Nicol (BMVT87B) - Prodigy
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: BILL CLINTON'S FAVORITE CHICKEN ENCHILADAS
 Categories: Tex/mexican, Main dish, Poultry
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      8 oz Canned whole green chilies
      1 lg Clove garlic, minced
     28 oz Can tomatoes
      2 c  Chopped onions
      2 ts Salt (divided)
    1/2 ts Oregano
      3 c  Shredded cooked chicken
      2 c  Sour cream
      2 c  Grated cheddar cheese
     15    Corn tortillas
           Vegetable oil
 
  Remove seeds from chilies and chop them.  In large skillet, heat small
  amount of oil.  Add chilies and garlic and saute'.
  
  Drain and break up tomatoes.  Reserve 1/2 cup liquid.  Add tomatoes,
  onion, 1 tsp. salt, oregano and reserved tomato liquid to the chilies
  and garlic. Simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until thick.  Remove
  from the skillet and set aside.
  
  Combine the chicken with the sour cream, grated Cheddar cheese and
  other teaspoon of salt.
  
  Heat 1/3 cup oil.  Dip tortillas in oil until they become limp.
  Drain well on paper towels.
  
  Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
  
  Fill the tortillas with chicken mixture.  Roll them up and arrange
  side by side, seam down, in 9x13" baking dish. Pour chili sauce over
  enchiladas. Bake about 20 minutes or until heated through.
  
  From:  San Diego Union Tribune
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: TEX-MEX DIP
 Categories: Dips/spread, Tex/mexican, Vegetables, Cheese/eggs
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      2 cn 10 1/2 oz. cans jalapeno
           -bean dip*
      8 oz Sour cream
    1/2 c  Mayonnaise
    1/2 pk Taco seasoning mix
      6    Ripe avocadoes
      4 tb Lemon juice
      1 ts Salt
    1/2 ts Pepper
      1 bn Chopped green onions
      1 lb Shredded cheddar cheese
 
  Spread bean dip in a 9x13" pan or two 8x8" pans (one can in each).
  In a medium bowl, blend the sour cream, mayonnaise, and taco
  seasoning mix. Pour oven bean dip and spread evenly.  Peel and seed
  the avocadoes; place in a large bowl and mash, getting the lumps out
  as much as possible.  Add the lemon juice, salt and pepper.  Pour
  over the sour cream mixture and spread evenly.  Spread the chopped
  green onion over all.  Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Serve
  chilled with tortilla chips.
  
  * = They now seem to make these in 9 oz.  If desired, use 3 9 oz.
  cans. Can usually be found in the potato chip aisle in the
  supermarket.
  
  Note:  If you are an olive lover, you can add some chopped or sliced
  drained black olives after the onions and before the cheese.
  
  From:  Debbie Carlson (adjusted from original recipe to my tastes)
 
MMMMM

      Title: SHREDDED BEEF FILLING
 Categories: Meats, Tex/mexican
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 md Onion -- chopped
  1 1/2 tb Vegetable oil
      2 c  Finely chopped or shredded
           -cooked
           -lean beef (leftover pot
           -roast are good)
      1 cn 4 oz chopped green chilies
      1 ts Ground cumin
      1 c  Canned or homemade enchilada
           -sauce
 
  Saute onion in hot oil in a skillet.  Blend in beef, chilies, cumin
  and enchilada sauce.  Simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Use
  for Chimichangas, tacos, enchiladas or tamales
  
  Source:  Food Editor's Hometown Favorites. Posted by:  Norma Kelley
  (KZWT99A) - Prodigy

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: JULIO'S HOT CARROTS
 Categories: Appetizers, Vegetables, Tex/mexican, Chilies, Hot/spicy
      Yield: 1 servings
 
      2 lb Carrots -- * see note
      1 cn Jalapenos -- ** see note
      2 md Onions -- sliced thin
      2 tb Vegetable oil
      1 c  Vinegar
           Salt and pepper
 
  This recipe makes about 1 gallon of hot carrots.
  
  *Use fresh carrots which have been peeled and cut into slices on the
  diagonal.
  
  **one 12 ounce jar of whole jalapenos with juice.
  
  In boiling water, cook carrots to desired tenderness. Do not
  overcook, they should still be crisp.   Drain.
  
  In a large glass jar or glass bowl, combine carrots, jalapenos and
  juice, onions, oil and vinegar. Add salt and pepper to taste.  Chill
  at least 3 hours.
  
  From:  Julio's Mexican Restaurant, San Diego Posted by:  Jo Merrill
  (ECGJ65B) - Prodigy

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: SUPER NACHOS
 Categories: Tex/mexican, Appetizers, Tasteofhome
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      1    Ripe avocado -- peeled
      1 ts Lemon juice
    1/2 c  Onion -- finely chopped
    1/2 c  Tomato -- chopped
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/8 ts Pepper
     15 oz Pinto beans -- rinsed and
           -drained
    2/3 c  Water -- divided
      2 tb Vegetable oil
    1/2 lb Ground beef
      1 tb Chili powder
      7 oz Tortilla chips
      2 c  Cheddar cheese -- shredded
      1 c  Sour cream
 
  "I have been to many Mexican restaurants, but none has an appetizer
  as good as the Super Nachos served at Loma-Linda's just outside
  Toledo." - Pat Garcia
  
  In a small bowl, mash the avocado with lemon juice. Stir in the onion,
  tomato, salt and pepper; set aside. Mash beans with 1/3 cup water;
  place in a skillet and cook over medium heat until hot. Stir in oil;
  remove from the heat and set aside. In another skillet, brown beef;
  drain. Stir in chili powder and remaining water; cook until liquid
  evaporates. Line a baking sheet with foil. Arrange chips in a single
  layer. Top with teaspoonfuls of bean and meat mixtures. Sprinkle with
  cheese. Bake at 400 degrees until cheese is melted, about 4 min. Top
  with avocado mixture and sour cream. Serve immediately. 6-8 servings.
  
  From:  "Taste of Home" Magazine, June/July 1995
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title:  "TRASH BAG" TACO SALAD
 Categories: Tex/mexican, Salads, Meats, Tasteofhome
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      3 lb Ground beef
      3    Env. taco seasoning mix
      3    Heads lettuce, shredded
      3 c  (12 oz.) shredded cheddar
           -cheese
      3 c  Chopped tomatoes
      2 c  Chopped onion
      3 cn (4 1/4 oz. ea.) chopped or
           -sliced
           Ripe olives, drained
      2 cn (15 oz. ea.) ranch or chili
           -beans,
           Drained
     16 oz Bag corn chips
     16 oz Bottle Catalina salad
           -dressing
     12 oz Jar salsa
 
  "This is the simplest and most economical crowd-pleaser we've ever run
  across." - Margie Dodd
  
  Brown beef; drain.  Add taco seasoning and prepare according to
  package directions.  Cool.  Toss with remaining ingredients in a
  large plastic bag or container.
  
  From:  "Taste of Home" Magazine, April/May 1995

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title:  TEXAS TACO PLATTER
 Categories: Main dish, Meats, Tex/mexican, Tasteofhome
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      2 lb Ground beef
      1 lg Onion, chopped
 14 1/2 oz Can tomatoes with liquid,
           -cut up
     12 oz Can tomato paste
     15 oz Can tomato puree
      2 tb Chili powder
      1 ts Ground cumin
    1/2 ts Garlic powder
      2 ts Salt
     28 oz Can ranch-style beans,
           -undrained
 10 1/2 oz Pkg. corn chips
      2 c  Hot cooked rice

MMMMM--------------------------TOPPINGS-------------------------------
      2 c  (8 oz.) shredded cheddar
           -cheese
      1 md Onion, chopped
      1    Head iceberg lettuce,
           -shredded
      3 md Tomatoes, chopped
      2    1/4 oz can sliced ripe
           -olives, drained
      1 c  Picante sauce, optional
 
  "I've used this recipe many times, and everyone enjoys it." - Kathy
  Young
  
  In a large skillet or Dutch oven, brown beef and onion; drain.  Add
  next 7 ingredients; simmer for 1 1/2 hours. Add beans and heat
  through.  On a platter, layer the corn chips, rice, meat mixture,
  cheese, onion, lettuce, tomatoes and olives.  Serve with picante
  sauce if desired.
  
  From:  "Taste of Home" Magazine, April/May 1995

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title:  VIVA A LA CHICKEN
 Categories: Poultry, Casseroles, Tex/mexican
      Yield: 6 servings
 
     10    Halves chicken breasts
      1    Dozen corn tortillas
      2 cn (10 3/4 oz. ea.) cream of
           -chicken
           Soup
      2 cn (10 3/4 oz. ea.) cream of
           -mushroom
           Soup
      2 c  Milk
      1    Onion, grated or chopped
           -fine
      2    7 oz cans green chili salsa
      1 lb Cheddar cheese, grated
      1    Cube chicken bouillon
      1 c  Boiling water
 
  Place chicken breasts in buttered baking dish - brush with melted
  butter; salt and pepper.  Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.
  
  Bone, skin and cut chicken into bite-size pieces; set aside.  Cut
  tortillas lengthwise into 1" strips; set aside. In a separate bowl,
  combine soups, milk, onion and chili salsa; mix well.
  
  In a small bowl, dissolve bouillon cube in 1 cup boiling water.  Place
  about 3 Tbsp. of this bouillon over bottom of a buttered 3-qt.
  casserole (throw rest of bouillon away). Place one half of the
  tortilla strips in the bottom of the casserole, 1/3 of the chicken,
  half of the soup mixture, remaining tortillas, remaining chicken and
  sauce. Top whole thing with grated cheese. Cover and refrigerate for
  at least 24 hours.
  
  Preheat oven to 300 degrees and bake for 1 1/2 hours or until heated
  through.
  
  Note:  I usually boil the chicken for about 45-60 minutes instead of
  baking it.  This renders a moister chicken and it's easy to skin
  after boiling. Mom used to serve this popular dish to company along
  with her Herb Bread and a green salad with her French Dressing. -
  Debbie Carlson
  
  From:  Mom (Dulcinea Ertz)
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title:  SOMBRERO DIP
 Categories: Dips/spread, Tex/mexican, Meats
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 lb Ground beef
      1 lb Spicy refried beans
      7 oz Salsa
      1 ts Salt
    1/4 c  Chopped onion
      1    Clove minced garlic
    1/2 c  Shredded Jack w/ Jalapenos
           -cheese
    1/4 c  Chpped green onions
           Shredded cheddar cheese
 
  Brown beef until crumbly; drain.  Add onion and garlic. Cook until
  onion is soft.  Add remaining ingredients.  Cook until hot and
  bubbly.  Spoon into chafing or fondue dish. Garnish with cheese and
  green onions.  Serve hot with tortilla chips.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title:  BEEF ENCHILADA CASSEROLE
 Categories: Casseroles, Tex/mexican, Meats
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      2 lb Ground beef
      1 md Onion, chopped
      1 lb Can refried beans
      1 ts Salt
    1/8 ts Garlic powder
           Oil
    1/3 c  Taco sauce
     19 oz Can enchilada sauce
      1    Dozen corn tortillas
     10 oz Cheddar cheese, grated
 
  Saute beef and onions; drain.  Stir in beans, salt, garlic powder,
  and taco sauce.  Heat until bubbly.  Add enchilada sauce.  In a
  separate fry pan, pour in enough oil to about 1/4" and heat.  Soften
  tortillas, one at a time, by quickly dipping in hot oil, turning, and
  draining on paper towels.
  
  In a 3 quart casserole, make layers of tortillas and meat sauce.  Top
  with grated cheese.  Bake at 350 degrees for approximately 45 minutes
  or until heated through.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Tweezer's White Chili #2
 Categories: Poultry, Chili
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 lb Large White Beans
      6 c  Chicken Broth
      1 lb Turkey Ham
      2 ts Wright's or Colgin smoke
           ;grilled, taste, BBQ
      2 ea Cloves Garlic, minced
      2 ea Medium Onions, chopped
      1 tb Olive Oil
      1 ea 4 oz. medium chilis, chooped
      2 ea Habanero's
      1 tb Cumin
  1 1/2 ts Oregano
    1/4 ts Ground Cloves
      1 ts Cayenne Pepper
      1 ts Chili Powder (or more)
      3 c  Monterey Jack
           Salsa
           Sour Cream
 
    Combine beans, broth, garlic and half the onions in a large soup
  pot. Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat, simmer until beans are soft (3
  hours or more) adding more broth if it's necessary.
    In a skillet, saute remaining onions in oil until tender.  Add
  chiles and seasonings and mix thoroughly.  Add the bean mixture.
  Simmer 1 hour or until it's just the way you like it.
    Salsa: You can use store-bought chunky Mexican tomato or make you
  own with your own peeled tomatoes, green chiles, onion, garlic, green
  onion, and fresh cilantro.
  Submitted By KEN KUBOS   On   07-22-95

      Title: Tweezer's White Chili #1
 Categories: Vegetables, Chili
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 lb Large White Beans
      6 c  Vegetable Broth
      2 ea Garlic, minced
      2 ea Onions, chopped
      1 tb Olive Oil
      2 ea 4-oz. Green chilis, chopped
      2 ts Ground Cumin
  1 1/2 ts Oregano
    1/4 ts Ground Cloves
    1/4 ts Cayenne Pepper
    1/4 ts Chili Powder
      3 c  Grated Monterey Jack
           Salsa
           Sour Cream
 
    Comine beans, broth, garlic and half of the onions in a large soup
  pot. Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat, simmer until beans are soft (3
  hours or more adding more broth if it's necessary.
    In a skillet, suate remaining onions in oil until tender.  Add
  chilis and seasonings and mix thoroughly.  Add to bean mixture.
  Simmer 1 hour or until it's just the way to like it.  Serve topped
  with grated cheese, salsa and sour cream.
    Salsa: You can use store-brought chunky Mexico tomato or make your
  own with peeled tomatoes, green chilis, onion, garlic, green onion
  and fresh cilantro.
  Submitted By KEN KUBOS   On   07-22-95

      Title: PETA Applesauce Bran Breakfast Cake
 Categories: Breakfast, Cake/cookie
      Yield: 6 servings
 
    1/4 c  Margerine
      2 c  Applesauce; sweet or unsweet
      1 c  Flour; unbleached
  1 1/2 c  Unprocessed wheat bran
           -flakes or oat bran
      1 c  Sugar
      1 ts Baking soda
      1 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
    1/4 ts Cloves
      1 c  Raisins
      1 c  Nuts; chopped
 
  Preheat the oven 350.  Grease the bottom only of a 9 inch square
  baking pan.
  
  In a large saucepan, heat the margerine and applesauce together over
  med heat until the margerine is just melted, then remove from heat.
  Add the remaining ingredients, stir quickly to moisten, then pour the
  batter into the baking pan.
  
  Bake 25-30 mins, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out
  clean.
  From the Compassionate Cook by PETA and Ingrid Newkirk Typed by Lisa
  Greenwood
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   07-22-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: PETA French Toast
 Categories: Breakfast, Pcake/waffl
      Yield: 2 servings
 
  1 1/2 c  Soy milk
      2 tb Flour; unbleached
      1 tb Nutritional yeast
      1 ts Sugar
      1 ts Cinnamon
      1 tb Veg oil
      4 sl Bread; to 6 slices, thick
 
  Mix the soy milk, flour, yeast, sugar and cinnamon vigorously with a
  wire whisk or beater.  Pour the mixture into a wide, shallow or pie
  pan.
  
  Heat the oil in a frying pan or skillet.  Dip a bread slice into the
  mixture and then place in skillet.  Fry each side until golden brown
  and crispy, about 5-7 mins total.  Remove from pan and keep warm
  while cooking remaining slices.
  
  Serve hot with maple syrup.
  From The Compassionate Cook by PETA and Ingrid Newkirk Typed by Lisa
  Greenwood
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   07-22-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: PETA Hot Chocolate
 Categories: Beverages, Breakfast
      Yield: 6 servings
 
    1/2 c  Unsweetened cocoa powder
    1/2 c  Sugar
      1 ds Salt
    1/2 c  Water
      6 c  Vanilla soy milk
           ;tofu whipped cream; opt
           ;cinnamon sticks; opt
 
  In a 2 quart saucepan, stir together the cooca, sugar, and salt until
  well blended.  Add the water and stir until smooth.  Cook the mixture
  over med heat until boiling, stirring constantly with a spoon or wire
  whisk. Lower the heat and cook 2 mins more, stirring constantly.
  
  Stir in the soy milk and heat until tiny bubbles form around the edge,
  stirring constantly.  Remove the pan from the heat.  Beat with a wire
  whisk or electric mixer until smooth and foamy, then pour into 8
  ounce mugs.
  
  Top with whipped tofu and garnish with cinnamon sticks.
  
  From The Compassionate Cook by PETA and Ingrid Newkirk Typed by Lisa
  Greenwood
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   07-22-95

      Title: PETA Lentil Carrot Burgers
 Categories: Vegetarian
      Yield: 10 servings
 
    1/4 c  Onion; finely chopped
    1/4 c  Grated carrots
    1/4 c  Water
      3 c  Cooked lentils, mashed
      2 tb Fresh parsley; chopped
      3 tb Tomato paste
    3/4 c  Bread crumbs
           ;salt to taste
           ;oil for frying
 
  Cook the onion and carrot in the water until tender, about 10 mins.
  Drain of excess water, then combine the onion and carrot with the
  remaining ingredients except oil.  Form into patties and fry in a
  lightly oiled frying pan until browned on both sides and heated
  through, about 10 mins. From The Compassionate Cook by PETA and
  Ingrid Newkirk Typed by Lisa Greenwood
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   07-22-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: PETA No Pork Sausage
 Categories: Breakfast, Vegetables, Sausage
      Yield: 6 servings
 
     10 oz Frozen lima beans; thawed
    3/4 c  Vegetable broth
    1/4 ts Sage
    1/4 ts Rosemary
      6 tb Cornmeal
      1 tb Veg oil; to 2T
 
  In a blender or food processor, coarsely chop the lima beans with the
  vegetable stock.  The lima beans should remain chunky.
  
  In a medium saucepan, heat the lima bean mixture, sage and rosemary
  until boiling.  Slowly beat in 4T of the cornmeal and cook until
  thickened and bubbly.  Cool to room temp.
  
  Sprinkle the rest of the cornmeal onto a pie plate.  Pat the lima bean
  mixture into 1/4 inch patties and coat each patty with some of the
  cornmeal on the pie plate.  In a large skillet, heat 1T of oil and
  fry the patties until lightly crisped and browned on both sides,
  about 5 mins. Add more oil if necessary.
  From the Compassionate Cook by PETA and Ingrid Newkirk Typed by Lisa
  Greenwood
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   07-22-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: PETA Onion Dip
 Categories: Dips/spread
      Yield: 3 cups
 
      1 lb Soft tofu
      2 tb Lemon juice
      2 ts Sugar
    1/2 ts Soy sauce; or tamari
      1 pk Vegan dry onion soup mix
 
  In a blender or food processor, combine tofu, lemon juice, sugar and
  soy sauce or tamari and blend until very smooth.  Pour the mixture
  into a serving bowl and stir in the soup mix.  Stir well and
  refrigerate for 4 hours.
  
  Serve with chips or raw veggies.
  From The Compassionate Cook by PETA and Ingrid Newkirk Typed by Lisa
  Greenwood
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   07-22-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: PETA Pancakes
 Categories: Breakfast, Pcake/waffl
      Yield: 1 servings
 
      1 c  Unbleached all purpose
           -flour
      1 tb Sugar
      2 tb Baking powder
    1/8 ts Salt
      1 c  Soy milk
      2 tb Veg oil
 
  Combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl and mix
  thoroughly.  Mix in the soy milk and oil, and with an electric mixer
  or wire whisk, beat just until batter is smooth.
  
  Measure 1/3c batter onto a hot, oiled griddle.  When bubbled appear
  on the upper surface of the pancake, about 2 mins, flip.  Cook the
  pancake for another 2 mins.  Remove from pan and keep warm while you
  make remaining pancakes.  Serve warm with maply syrup or fruit syrup.
  
  Makes 6-8 pancakes.
  
  From the Compassionate Cook by PETA and Ingrid Newkirk Typed by Lisa
  Greenwood
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   07-22-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: PETA Peanut Butter Coffee Cake
 Categories: Breakfast, Cake/cookie
      Yield: 12 servings
 
MMMMM--------------------------TOPPING-------------------------------
    1/2 c  Brown sugar; packed
    1/2 c  Flour
    1/4 c  Peanut butter
      3 tb Margerine

MMMMM----------------------------CAKE---------------------------------
  2 1/4 c  Flour
      1 c  Brown sugar; packed
      2 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt
      1 c  Soy milk
    1/2 c  Peanut butter
           Egg replacer equivalent
           -of 2 eggs
    1/4 c  Margerine
 
  Preheat the oven 375 degrees.  Grease a 9x13 baking pan.
  
  For the topping, mix the brown sugar and flour.  With a pastry knife,
  and fork, or your fingers, cut in the peanut butter and margerine
  until crumbly; set aside.
  
  For the cake, combine the flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking
  soda and salt.  Add the soy milk, peanut butter, egg replacer and
  margerine. Beat until smooth, about 3 mins with and electic mixer.
  Pour into the baking pan and sprinkle with topping.
  
  Bake 30 mins, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out
  clean. From The Compassionate Cook by PETA and Ingrid Newkrik Typed
  by Lisa Greenwood
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   07-22-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: PETA Sloppy Joes
 Categories: Vegetarian, Sandwich
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2 tb Margerine; or water
    1/2 c  Onion; minced
    1/2 c  Green pepper; minced
      1 lb Firm tofu; patted dry and
           -mashed
      6 tb Ketchup
      6 tb Chili sauce
    1/2 ts Salt
           ;pepper to taste
      4    Burger buns; lightly toasted
 
  Heat the margerine or water in a large skillet over med heat.  Add the
  onion and green pepper and saute or broil until the veggies are well
  cooked, about 5 mins.  Add the mashed tofu and saute for another 15
  mins, until the tofu is completely cooked.
  
  Add the ketchup, chili sauce, salt, and pepper and continue to cook
  over low heat until the mixture is heated thru.  Add a little water
  if the mixture is too dry.
  
  Spoon into burg buns.
  From The Compassionate Cook by PETA and Ingrid Newkirk Typed by Lisa
  Greenwood
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   07-22-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: PETA Spanish Tofu Omelette
 Categories: Breakfast, Vegetables
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      1 tb Olive oil; or water
      1 cl Garlic; minced
      1 sm Onion; chopped
      1 md Potato; sliced
    1/4 ea Green bell pepper; diced
      1 sm Tomato; chopped
    1/4 ts Oregano
      1 lb Soft tofu; patted dry
    1/4 c  Flour; unbleached
    1/4 ts Tumeric
      1 ts Nutritional yeast
           ;salt and pepper to taste
 
  In a frying pan over med heat, heat the oil or water and saute the
  garlic, onion, potato, and green pepper until the potato is cooked,
  about 10 mins.
  
  In the meantime, blend the reamining ingredients in a blender until
  smooth. Add the tomato and tofu mixture to the pan and cook, covered,
  over a very low heat until the omelette is set, about 10 mins.
  
  Serve with salsa.
  From The Compassionate Cook by PETA and Ingrid Newkirk Typed by Lisa
  Greenwood
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   07-22-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: PETA Streusel Coffee Cake
 Categories: Breakfast, Cake/cookie
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      1 c  Soy milk
      1 tb Distilled white vinegar
    1/3 c  Soft tofu
  2 1/4 c  Flour; or w.w. pastry flour
  1 1/4 c  Brown sugar; packed
      3 ts Cinnamon
  1 1/2 ts Ginger
    1/2 ts Salt
    3/4 c  Veg oil
    3/4 c  Walnuts; chopped
      1 ts Baking powder
      1 ts Baking soda
 
  Preheat the oven to 350.  Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
  
  Place the soy milk, vinegar, and tofu in a blender and blend until
  completely smooth.
  
  In a large bowl, mix the flour, brown sugar, 2 1/2t of cinnamon,
  ginger, salt, and oil.  Work the mixture with a pastry knife, a fork,
  or your fingers until well blended.  Transfer 1 1/4c of this mixture
  to a small bowl and mix in the remaining 1/2t cinnamon and the
  walnuts. Set aside.
  
  To the remaining flour mixture, add the baking powder and baking soda,
  along with the blended tofu.  Mix until smooth.  Spread the batter
  evenly in the baking dish and sprinkle the reserved flour-nut mixture
  over the top.
  
  Bake for 30-35 mins, or until a cake tester inserted in the center
  comes out clean.
  From The Compassionate Cook by PETA and Ingrid Newkirk Typed by Lisa
  Greenwood
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   07-22-95

      Title: PETA Tofu Fruit Spread
 Categories: Dips/spread, Condiments, Breakfast, Fruit

      2    Sweet apples; peeled, cored

      2    Ripe bananas; peeled and

      Title: PETA Tony and Elaine La Russa's Tofu Onion Burgers
 Categories: Vegetarian, Main dish
      Yield: 4 servings
 
    1/2 lb Firm tofu; mashed well
      1 md Onion; chopped very fine
      2 tb Wheat germ
      2 tb Flour
      2 ts Garlic powder
      2 tb Soy sauce; or tamari
           ;pepper to taste
           ;oil for frying
 
  Mix all the ingredients except oil in a bowl and form patties. Heat a
  little oil in a skillet and fry patties until brown and very crisp,

      Title: PETA Tofu Scrambles
 Categories: Breakfast, Vegetables
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      1 lb Firm tofu; patted dry
           -and mashed
    1/8 ts Tumeric
      1 ts Onion powder
    1/2 ts Salt
      1 c  Finely chopped veggies;
           -bell pepper, fresh
           -mushrooms, onions,
           -tomatoes, etc
 
  Place the tofu in a lightly oiled saute pan and cook over med heat
  for 3 mins.  Add the remaining ingredients, stir well, and cook for
  5-8 mins, until the veggies are thoroughly cooked and the tofu is
  heated thru.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: PETA Vegetable Broth
 Categories: Soup/stew, Vegetables
      Yield: 2 quarts
 
    1/2 ts Parsley
    1/4 ts Thyme
    1/2 ts Black pepper
      1    Bay leaf
      2 lg Carrots; slices
      2    Stalks celery; sliced
      2 md White onions; sliced
      2 lg White or red potatoes;
           -quartered
      1 lg Clove garlic
    1/2 ts Salt
 
  Put the prepared vegetables and herbs in a large pot and add water to
  cover.  Bring the vegetables to a boil, uncovered.  Lower the heat,
  cover and simmer 1 1/2 hours.
  
  Strain thru a colander for a thin broth or stock.  For a richer broth,
  puree the mixture in a blender.
  From The Compassionate Cook by PETA and Ingrid Newkirk Typed by Lisa
  Greenwood
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   07-22-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Pasta With Korean Sesame Sauce
 Categories: Side dish, Vegetarian
      Yield: 4 servings
 
     10 oz Angel hair pasta
      1 tb Dark sesame oil
      3 tb White vinegar
      2 tb Hot bean paste
      2 tb Soy sauce
      3 tb Green onions -- sliced
      2    Cloves garlic -- finely
           Chopped
      2 ts Ginger root -- grated
      1 ts Sugar
      1 ts Pepper
      1 md Cucumber -- thinly sliced
 
  Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente.  Drain.
  Combine sesame oil, vinegar, bean paste, soy, onion, garlic, ginger,
  sugar and pepper in medium-size bowl.  Heat large skillet over medium
  heat.  Add sesame seeds; cook, shaking skillet occasionally, 2 to 3
  minutes or until toasted and golden.  Add pasta along with vinegar
  mixture to skillet, tossing to coat.  Garnish with cucumbers and
  serve.  172 calories and 8 grams fat.
  
  Recipe By     : Family Circle 4/25/95
  
  From: Meg Antczak                     Date: 07-23-95 (22:15) (159)
  Fido: Cooking

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Spicy Sausage Vegetable Strata
 Categories: Main dish
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      1 lb Bulk sausage (spicy)
      1 md Onion -- chopped
      1    French bread loaf -- sliced
           -3/4 inch thick
    1/2 c  Roasted red peppers -- cut
           -in 1/4 inch strips
      2 md Zucchini (about 2 cups) --
           -thinly sliced
      6    Egg
    3/4 c  Ricotta cheese
      2 c  Milk
    1/2 c  Parmesan cheese -- grated
 
  Cook sausage and onion in 10" skillet over medium heat, stirring
  occasionally, until sausage is no longer pink; drain well.  Arrange
  bread slices in 11 x 7 baking dish.  Spread sausage mixture over
  bread.  Top with peppers and zucchini.  Beat eggs and ricotta cheese
  in medium bowl until blended.  Stir in milk.  Pour over mixture in
  baking dish.  Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
  
  TO STORE: Cover tightly and refrigerate at least 2 hours but no longer
  than 24 hours.
  
  TO COOK: About 1 hour before serving, heat oven to 350.  Uncover pan
  an bake 45 to 55 minutes or until top is puffed and center is set.
  Serve immediately.
  
  Recipe By     : BC Do-Ahead Cookbook
  
  From: Meg Antczak                     Date: 07-23-95 (22:23) (159)
  Fido: Cooking
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Dilled Beef And Bean Soup
 Categories: Soup/stew
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      1 tb Oil
      1 lb Beef round -- cubed
      3 c  Beef broth
      1 lg Onion -- chopped
      2 ts Dried dill weed
    1/8 ts Pepper
      1    Bay leaf
      2    Stalks celery
      2 md Carrots -- sliced
     15 oz Black beans -- drained &
           -rinsed
    1/4 c  Sour cream
 
  Heat oil in dutch oven over medium heat until hot.  Cook beef in oil
  about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until brown; drain.  Stir in
  broth, onion, dillweed, pepper and bay leaf.  Heat to boiling; reduce
  heat. Cover and simmer 30 to 45 minutes or until beef is almost
  tender.  Stir in celery and carrots.  Heat to boiling; reduce heat.
  Cover and simmer about 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
  Remove bay leaf and stir in beans.
  
  
  TO STORE: Refrigerator-store tightly covered no longer than 48 hours.
  Freezer-Cool soup 30 minutes.  Place in labeled airtight 2 quart
  freezer containers.  Freeze no longer than 2 months.
  
  TO REHEAT FROM REFRIGERATOR: Stove-About 25 minutes before serving,
  heat soup in 3 quart saucepan over medium heat, stirring
  occasionally, until hot.  Top each serving with sour cream.
  Microwave-About 15 minutes before serving, place in casserole. Cover
  and microwave on high 10 to 12 minutes, stirring after 5 minutes
  until hot.  Top each serving with sour cream.
  
  TO REHEAT FROM FREEZER: Stove-About 40 minutes before serving, dip
  container into hot water to loosen; remove container.  Cover and heat
  in 3 quart saucepan over medium heat, turning and stirring
  occasionally, until hot.  Top with sour cream. Microwave-About 35
  minutes before serving, remove lid from freezer container; place
  container upside down in 2 quart casserole. Microwave on HIGH 5
  minutes; remove container.  Cover and microwave on high 10 to 15
  minutes longer, breaking up and stirring every 5 minutes until hot.
  Serve with sour cream.  350 calories and 13 grams fat.
  
  Recipe By     : BC Do-Ahead Cookbook
  
  From: Meg Antczak                     Date: 07-23-95 (22:23) (159)
  Fido: Cooking
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Spicy Chili
 Categories: Chili
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      2 lb Ground beef
      2 lg Onions -- chopped
      3 cn Tomatoes (28 oz each) --
           -undrained
      3 cn Beans (any combination 16 oz
           -each) - drained
     15 oz Tomato sauce
      4 oz Green chiles -- chopped
    1/4 c  Chili powder
      1 tb Cumin
    1/2 ts Salt
    1/2 ts Pepper
           Shredded cheddar cheese
           Chopped green onions
 
  Cook ground beef and onions in 6 quart dutch oven over medium heat
  about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until beef is brown and
  onion is tender; drain.  Stir in remaining ingredients except cheese
  and onion. Break up tomatoes.  Heat to boiling; reduce heat.  Simmer
  uncovered 1 1/4 hours. Spoon off fat if necessary.
  
  TO STORE: Refrigerator-Refrigerate tightly covered no longer than 4
  days. Freezer-Divide chili among 3 labeled airtight 2 quart freezer
  containers. Cool quickly.  Freeze no longer than 2 months.
  
  TO REHEAT FROM REFRIGERATOR: Stove-About 15 minutes before serving,
  cover and heat about 6 cups chili in 2 quart saucepan over medium
  heat 7 to 9 minutes, stirring occasionally, until hot.
  Microwave-About 15 minutes before serving, place chili in 2 quart
  casserole. Cover tightly and microwave on high 10 to 12 minutes,
  stirring every 4 minutes, until hot. TO
  
  REHEAT FROM FREEZER: Stove-About 45 minutes before serving, dip
  container into hot water to loosen; remove container. Cover and heat
  chili and 1/2 cup water in 2 quart saucepan over medium high heat 20
  minutes, turning and stirring occasionally. Uncover and heat about 15
  minutes lomger, stirring occasionally, until hot. Microwave-About 30
  minutes before serving, remove lid from 1 freezer container; place
  upside down in 2 quart casserole. Microwave on high 5 minutes; remove
  container. Cover and microwave 20 to 25 minutes, breaking up and
  stirring every 5 minutes, until hot. 295 calories and 13 grams fat.
  
  Recipe By     : BC Do-Ahead Cookbook
  
  From: Meg Antczak                     Date: 07-23-95 (22:25) (159)
  Fido: Cooking
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Sloppy Joes
 Categories: Sandwich
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 lb Ground beef
      1 lg Onion -- chopped
      1 sm Green bell pepper --
           -chopped
 14 1/2 oz Stewed tomatoes (mexican
           -style) - undrained
    1/4 c  Chili sauce
      1 ts Dried thyme
      2 ts Mustard
      1 ts Worcestershire sauce
    1/4 ts Celery seed
      1 tb Cold water
      1 ts Cornstarch
      6    Hamburger buns
 
  Cook ground beef, onion and bell pepper in 10" skillet over medium
  heat about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until beef is brown;
  drain.  Stir in tomatoes, chili sauce, thyme, mustard, worcestershire
  sauce and celery seed.  Heat to boiling; reduce heat.  Cover and
  simmer 5 minutes.  Mix water and cornstarch; stir into beef mixture.
  Boil and stir 1 minute.
  
  TO STORE:  Refrigerator-Refrigerate tightly covered no longer than 48
  hours. Freezer-Cool mixture 30 minutes.  Place in labeled airtight 1
  1/2 quart freezer container.  Freeze no longer than 2 months.
  
  TO REHEAT FROM REFRIGERATOR: About 15 minutes before serving, cover
  and heat beef mixture in 3 quart saucepan over medium heat, stirring
  frequently, until hot and bubbly. Microwave-About 10 minutes before
  serving, place beef mixture in 1 1/2 quart casserole.  Cover and
  microwave on high 8 to 10 minutes, stirring every 3 minutes, until
  hot and bubbly.
  
  TO REHEAT FROM FREEZER: Stove-About 20 minutes before serving, dip
  container into hot water to loosen; remove container.  Cover and heat
  in 3 quart saucepan over medium heat, turning and stirring
  occasionally, until hot and bubbly. Microwave-About 20 minutes before
  serving, remove lid from freezer container; place container upside
  down in 2 quart casserole. Microwave on high 5 minutes; remove
  container. Cover and microwave 10 to 15 minutes longer, breaking up
  and stirring every 5 minutes, until hot and bubbly. 375 calories and
  18 grams fat.
  
  Recipe By     : BC Do-Ahead Cookbook
  
  From: Meg Antczak                     Date: 07-23-95 (22:25) (159)
  Fido: Cooking

      Title: 7 Layer Chef's Salad
 Categories: Salads
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      3 c  Lettuce -- bite size
      3 c  Spinach -- bite size
      2 c  Smoked ham -- chopped
      2 c  Cauliflower flowerets
      1 md Zucchini -- thinly sliced
      2    Eggs, hard-boiled -- Peeled
           & Sliced
    3/4 c  Mayonnaise
    1/2 c  Creamy italian dressing
      1 c  Cheddar cheese -- shredded
    1/4 c  Parsley -- chopped
 
  Mix lettuce and spinach in large glass bowl.  Layer ham and
  cauliflower on lettuce mixture.  Place zucchini in center of bowl.
  Arrange egg slices around edge of bowl.  Mix mayonaise and italian
  dressing; carefully spread over top of salad to edge of bowl.
  Sprinkle with cheese and parsley. Cover tightly and refrigerate no
  longer than 24 hours.  Toss before serving if desired.  780 calories
  and 70 grams fat.  (Yikes!!! Wish I'd seen that before I went to the
  trouble to type this in.  Oh well...)

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Italian Chicken Rolls
 Categories: Poultry
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      4    Skinless boneless chicken
           -breast halves
      2 sl Provolone cheese -- cut in
           -half
      4 sl Pastrami -- thinly sliced
    1/3 c  Italian bread crumbs
    1/4 c  Parmesan cheese -- grated
      2 tb Parsley -- finely chopped
 
  Grease square 8 x 8 pan.  Flatten each chicken breast half to 1/4"
  thickness between plastic wrap or waxed paper.  Place 1 piece
  provolone cheese and 1 slice pastrami on each chicken piece.  Fold
  long sides of each chicken piece over pastrami.  Roll up chicken from
  short side; secure with toothpick.  Mix bread crumbs, cheese and
  parsley.  Dip chicken rolls into milk; coat evenly with bread crumb
  mixture.  Place seam sides down in pan.
  
  
  TO SERVE NOW: Heat oven to 425.  Bake uncovered about 30 minutes.
  
  TO STORE: Freeze unbaked chicken rolls uncovered about 1 hour or until
  firm. Wrap tightly and label.  Freeze no longer than 2 months.
  
  TO COOK: About 1 1/4 hours before serving, heat oven to 375.  Bake
  uncovered about 50 minutes. 310 calories and 15 grams fat.
  
  Recipe By     : BC Do-Ahead Cookbook
  
  From: Meg Antczak                     Date: 07-23-95 (22:26) (159)
  Fido: Cooking

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Dietetic Peanuts
 Categories: Diabetic, Chocolate, Nuts/grains, Candies
      Yield: 1 servings
 
      1 lb Whitecoat chocolate coating
    1/2 c  Peanut butter
 
  In the top of a double boiler, melt coating over hot, not boiling,
  water. Add peanut butter and blend until smooth. Fill peanut molds
  almost full and chill in freezer until firm. Turn over and tap
  peanuts from molds. Makes about 75 peanuts. Source: Ideals Candy
  Cookbook by Mildred Brand Copyright-MCMLXXIX By Mildred Brand,
  Milwaukee, Wis. 53201
  
  From: Jeffrey Dean                    Date: 11-18-93
  Submitted By MICHELLE HOWE   On   07-22-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Pickled Garlic
 Categories: Pickles, Can/preserv, Herbs/spice
      Yield: 2 half pints
 
    1/2 lb Garlic cloves
      1 lg Red pepper, seeded and
           Slivered
      2 c  White vinegar
    2/3 c  Granulated sugar
    1/2 ts Mustard seed
    1/2 ts Celery seed
 
   Peel garlic. Leave small cloves whole. Cut large cloves in half.
  Combine with red pepper.
   Measure vinegar and sugar into saucepan. PLace mustard seed and
  celery seed into cotton bag. Tie. Add to saucepan. Heat on
  medium-high, stirring frequently, until it boils. Boil 5 minutes. Add
  garlic and red pepper. return to a boil. Boil 5 minutes more. Discard
  spice bag. Fill hot sterilized jars with garlic and red peppers to
  within 1 inch of top. Fill with hot brine to 1/4-inch of top. Seal.
  Let stand several weeks before serving.
  
  Make 2 half pints.
  Source: Company's Coming by Jean Pare
  
  From the collection of Karen Deck
  Submitted By KAREN DECK   On   07-23-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Pickled Garlic (Gratiam Dong)
 Categories: Pickles, Herbs/spice, Can/preserv, Thai
      Yield: 1 servings
 
      7 oz Garlic cloves
      1 c  White granulated sugar
    3/4 c  Thai coconut vinegar
      1 tb Salt
      1 c  Water
 
    Peel the garlic, soak in salted water overnight, then rinse. In
  medium pan, combine the sugar, vinefar, salt and water. Bring to the
  boil, stirring, and when the sugar has dissolved, remove from heat
  and cool. PLace the garlic into a resealable bottle and cover with
  the liquid. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 1
  month before using. Source: Classic Thai Cuisine by David Thompson
  ISBN 0-89815-563-0 Ten Speed Press
  
  From the collection of Karen Deck
  Submitted By KAREN DECK   On   07-23-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Beans & Beef
 Categories: Healthy, Meats, Vegetables
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 lb Ground beef
      1 lg Onion, diced
      2 cl Garlic, minced
    1/2    Green bell pepper, diced
    1/2    Red bell pepper, diced
      2 c  Canned no salt added
           -tomatoes
      1 c  Cooked kidney beans
    1/2 ts Chili powder or to taste
 
  Preheat oven to 350F. Spray a 1 1/2-qt. baking dish with Pam. Brown
  meat in a medium size skillet; drain off fat. Ad onion, garlic, bell
  peppers and tomatoes; cook 10 minutes. Add beans and chili powder.
  Spoon mixture into baking dish. Cover and bake 1 1/2 hours. Remove
  cover. Bake 20 minutes more. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.
  
  Per serving without rice: Calories: 194 Protein: 23g Carbohydrates:
  12g Fat: 5g Sodium: 123mg Cholesterol: 47mg
  
  Cooking for Good Health by Gloria Rose ISBN: 0-89529-577-6 Entered by
  Carolyn Shaw 3-95
  Submitted By IRIS GRAYSON   On   07-23-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Beer Bread
 Categories: Breads, Alcohol
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      3 c  Self-rising flour
      3 tb Sugar
      1 cn 12 oz beer
 
  Mix all three ingredients.  Batter will be thick and lumpy.  Grease a
  standard size loaf pan (Pam works great)  Bake at 350 deg. for 50
  minutes, brush top with melted butter and bake for 10 more.
  
  Enjoy (we've had it every night this week!)
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Beer-Herb Bread *****
 Categories: Breads
      Yield: 2 servings
 
MMMMM-----------------------*INGREDIENTS*----------------------------
      2 pk Dry yeast
    1/2 c  Lukewarm water
    1/4 c  Sugar
      1 tb Salt
     12 oz Great Western Beer, heated
           -to lukewarm
      2    Eggs, lightly beaten
      1 ts Sage
      2 ts Thyme
      3 ts Savory
      1 sm Onion, grated
      7 c  Flour (aproximately)
 
  Sprinkle the yeast over the lukewarm water and stir to disolve.
  combine the heated beer, sugar, salt and melted butter with the yeast
  mixture. Add the eggs, sage, thyme, savory, grated onion and 4 cups
  of the flour and beat until the mixture is smooth.  Add enough
  remaining flour until the mixture becomes difficult to beat.  Turn
  dough out onto a lightly floured board and begin kneading, adding
  enough of the remaining flour so that the dough does not stick to
  your hands or the board. Continue to knead until the dough is smooth
  and elastic. Place the dough in a oiled bowl, cover it with a damp
  cloth and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk. About 1 1/2
  hours. When the dough has risen, punch it down and let it rest for 10
  ~ 15 minutes.  Divide the dough in two pieces and shape each one into
  a round loaf.  Place each in a loaf pan and let rise until double.
  Bake the loaves in a preheated 400 degree oven for 35 minutes. Remove
  the loaves from pans, and let cool on wire racks. This bread should
  be served slightly warm. You may also freeze the loaves and reheat as
  needed. This dough also makes wonderful dinner rolls or hamburger
  buns Makes 2 loaves
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cheesey Beer Bread
 Categories: Cheese/eggs, Breads, Alcohol
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      3 c  Flour
      4 ts Baking powder
      2 ts Salt
  1 1/2    Grated cheddar cheese
    1/2 c  Freshly grated parmesan
           -cheese
      1 tb Dried parsley
      1 c  Beer
      1 tb Liquid honey
 
  Combine flour, baking powder, salt, cheeses and parsley. Stir in beer
  and honey until well mixed. Spread into a greased loaf pan. Bake at
  350 degrees F for 45 minutes until browned on the outside, and a
  toothpick inserted comes out clean. Turn out on a rack to cool.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cherry Cake (Beer Recipe)
 Categories: Alcohol, Fruit, Cake/cookie, Desserts
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      4    Eggs
      2 c  Sugar
      2 ts Vanilla
      2 c  Sifted all-purpose flour
      2 ts Baking powder
    1/4 ts Salt
      2 tb Butter, melted
      1 c  Beer
      1 c  Maraschino cherries
 
  Preheat oven to 375. Beat eggs until thick and lemon colored.
  Gradually beat in sugar. Add vanilla. Fold sifted flour, baking
  powder and salt into egg mixture. Heat beer. Add beer and melted
  butter at once to batter. Pour into greased cherry-lined tube or
  molded pan. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Turn out on cake rack to
  cool. Prick top of cake and drizzle with 4 tbsp of warm beer.
  
  From: Arizona Cookbook
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cheese 'n Pretzel Beer Loaf
 Categories: Alcohol, Tex/mexican, Breads
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 c  Beer
      1    Egg yolk
    1/2 ts Salt
      2 ts Melted butter
    2/3 c  Cheddar cheese, shredded
      1 pk Hot roll mix
      2 tb Crushed pretzels
 
  Preheat oven to 375. Put in large bowl. Sprinkle yeast from mix to
  warm beer. Stir to dissolve. Add egg yolk, salt, butter, cheese and
  hot roll mix. Blend well. Cover. Let rise in a warm place until
  double in bulk. Knead for 5 minutes of floured board. Place in
  greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. Cover. Let rise in a warm place until
  doubled in size.
  
  Bake 30 minutes at 375. Remove from oven and brush with one egg white.
  Sprinkle with two tablespoons crushed pretzels. Bake 5 more minutes.
  Turn out on wire rack to cool.
  
  From: Arizona Cookbook
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: BEER POTATO SALAD
 Categories: Potatoes, Salads
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      3 lb Potatoes
      2 c  Diced celery
      1 sm Onion, chopped
           Salt
      1 c  Mayonnaise
      2 tb Prepared mustard
    1/4 ts Hot pepper sauce
    1/2 c  Beer
      2 tb Chopped parsley
 
  Makes 8 servings
  
  Beer added to the dressing makes this potato salad a standout.
  
  Cook potatoes in skins until tender.  When cool, peel and dice. Add
  celery and onion and season to taste with salt. Blend mayonnaise with
  mustard and hot pepper sauce. Gradually stir in beer. Add parsley.
  Pour over potato mixture. Mix lightly with fork. Chill.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Beer Chicken
 Categories: Poultry, Main dish, Bbq/grill
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      8    To 10 chicken breasts
           (or your favorite parts)
    1/3 c  Butter, melted
           Juice from 8 medium lemons
           (or about 1 1/2 cups juice)
      1 cn Of beer
      1 ts Garlic salt
      1 ts Lemon pepper
 
  Combine butter, beer, lemon juice, garlic, lemon pepper.  Pour over
  chicken and refrigerate 4 to 6 hours.  Barbecue chicken, brushing
  sauce over pieces as you turn them.  Grill about 15 to 20 minutes per
  side.
  
  Good and simple recipe for grilled chicken.  Serve with broccoli-rice
  casserole and grilled Vidalia onions and you have a great weekend
  barbeque menu.  Add a salad and garlic bread and it's a fantastic
  weekend barbecue!
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Beer Braised Beef in Crock Pot
 Categories: Meats, Crockpot
      Yield: 6 servings
 
           Ingredients:
      3 lb Lean beef stew meat cut into
           -1 1/2 inch pieces
      1 ts Salt
    1/2 ts Pepper
      2 md Onions thinly sliced
      1    8 oz can mushrooms (or
           -pieces) un-drained
      1    12 oz can of beer
 
  (I prefer a dark beer, and my favorite dark beer is Negro Modelo, a
  Mexican beer) 1 Tbsp vinegar 2 beef bouillon cubes 2 tsp sugar 2
  cloves garlic, minced 1 tsp thyme 2 bay leaves
  
  Put the beef in the crock pot.  Combine all the other ingredients and
  pour over the beef.  Cook on low for 8-10 hours or on high for 4-5
  hours. Before serving thicken juices if desired.  Joyce says she uses
  some flour or corn starch to do this.

      Title: Beer Marinade for Beef (Cajun Style)
 Categories: Salsa/sauce, Bbq/grill, Meats
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      2 cn Beer (12 oz or 10 oz cans)
      2 ts Salt
    1/2 c  Olive oil
      1 ts Ground cayenne pepper
      1 tb Wine vinegar
      1 tb Prepared horseradish
      1 ts Onion powder
      2 tb Lemon juice
      1 ts Garlic powder
 
  Mix all ingredients together and use as a marinade. Then use as a
  basting sauce for the meat while it cooks.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: BEER AND PRETZELS CHICKEN-PERDUE
 Categories: Poultry
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      1    Perdue chicken, cut-up
    1/3 c  Flour
      1 ts Paprika
      2 ts Salt
    1/4 ts Ginger
    1/4 ts Pepper
    1/2 c  Beer
      1    Egg
    1/2 c  Finely crushed pretzels
    1/4 c  Grated parmesan cheese
    1/4 c  Crushed bacon bits
      1 tb Dried parsley flakes
 
  ~The Perdue Chicken Cookbook
  
  Mix flour, paprika, salt, ginger and pepper in a mixing bowl. Add
  beer and egg, beat with a hand mixer to make smooth batter. Mix
  crushed pretzels, parmesan cheese, bacon bits and parsley in plastic
  bag. Dip chicken pieces one at a time in batter, the place in bag
  with pretzels mix and shake to coat. Place coated chicken pieces in
  shallow baking pan, skin side up. Bake, covered, at 350 F for 30
  minutes. remove cover. Continue baking, uncovered, approximately 30
  mnutes longer, or until done.

      Title: Cajun Spice Mix
 Categories: Herbs/spice, Hot/spicy, Cajun/creol
      Yield: 2 /3
 
  7 1/2 tb Paprika
      6 tb Garlic Powder
      6 tb Ground Black Pepper
      3 tb Ground Red Pepper
      3 tb Dried Thyme
      3 tb Dried Oregano
      3 tb Onoin Powder
 
  Blend all ingredients.  Transfer to small jar, seal tightly. Store in
  cool, dry place.  Makes about 2/3 cup.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cajun spice mix II
 Categories: Cajun/creol, Herbs/spice
      Yield: 6 servings
 
    1/2 ts Black pepper
    1/2 ts Red pepper
    1/2 ts Garlic powder
    1/2 ts Onion powder
    1/4 ts Thyme (ground)
    1/4 ts Oregano
    1/4 ts White pepper
 
  Mix ingredients together and store in air tight container.
  
  This spice mix is loosly based on a spice mix from the Prudhomme
  Family Cookbook's recipe for Fried Catfish and Sweet Hushpuppies.  It
  can be used to season any seafood dish.  I also use it to season
  Porcupine Meatballs and other "cajun" inspired dishes.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cajun seasoning
 Categories: Herbs/spice, Cajun/creol
      Yield: 2 servings
 
      1 c  (250ml) salt
    1/4 c  (63ml) cayenne pepper
    1/4 c  (63ml) black pepper
    1/4 c  (63 ml granulated garlic
    1/4 c  (63ml) onion powder
  1 1/2 tb (23ml) paprika
  1 1/2 tb (23ml) celery seed
 
  [ note:  use only dried seasonings ]
  
  In a food processor add salt and cayenne pepper. process for 30
  seconds. Add black pepper and granulated garlic and process another
  15 seconds. Add remaining ingredients and process another minute.
  Store in air- tight container. Use for gumbo,jambalaya,etouffe, or
  for your regular cooking. Can also be used like salt at the dinner
  table. makes about 2-1/4 cups (563ml)

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: SANDIES
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Holiday
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      2 c  Butter, softened (1 lb.)
      1 c  Powdered sugar
      4 ts Vanilla
      2 tb Water
      4 c  Flour
      2 c  Pecans, chopped
           Powdered sugar (approx. 3/4
           -lb. total needed
           For recipe)
 
  Cream butter and 1 cup powdered sugar.  Add the vanilla and water.
  Add flour; mix well and add pecans.  Pinch off approximately 1
  heaping Tbsp. dough.  Form small rolls, 1 1/2" long.  Or, roll into a
  ball and then between palms, flatten somewhat to form circular
  cookies.  Bake on an ungreased cookie sheet at 300 degrees for 20
  minutes. While hot, roll in additional powdered sugar to coat.  Let
  cool and store in container with waxed paper separating layers of
  cookies.
  
  ** This recipe has already been doubled from Mom's original recipe.
  You can't make too many of these rich cookies!
  
  From:  Mom (Dulcinea Ertz)
  
  Posted by:  Debbie Carlson

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: MOM'S FAVORITE GINGERBREAD
 Categories: Breads, Desserts
      Yield: 6 servings
 
    1/2 c  Shortening
      2 tb Sugar
      1    Egg
      1 c  Black molasses
      1 c  Boiling water
  2 1/4 c  Flour
      1 ts Baking soda
    1/2 ts Salt
      1 ts Ginger
      1 ts Cinnamon
           Dark brown sugar
 
  Mix the shortening, sugar and egg together.  Blend in the boiling
  water and molasses.  Sift dry ingredients together and stir into the
  wet mixture. Pour into well greased 9" square pan.  Sprinkle with
  brown sugar.  Bake in a preheated 325 degree oven for 45 to 50
  minutes.
  
  From:  Mom (Dulcinea Ertz)

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: PEANUT BUTTER BALLS
 Categories: Candies, Chocolate, Desserts, Holiday
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 lb Butter
      1 lb Creamy peanut butter
     12 oz Chocolate chips
      2 lb Powdered sugar
    1/3    Stick parafin wax
           Whole walnuts
 
  Melt together butter and peanut butter in a large pan.  Once melted,
  remove from heat and add powdered sugar; mix well.  It will look like
  cookie dough. Roll into balls the size of large walnuts.
  
  In a double boiler, melt the chocolate chips along with approximately
  1/3 to 1/2 stick of parafin.
  
  Dip balls with a toothpick into chocolate mixture and put on wax
  paper. Remove the toothpick and cover the whole with a whole walnut
  piece.
  
  From:  Jean Paluso Posted by: Debbie Carlson
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: NEW DUCHESS SPICE CAKE W/ MAPLE BUTTERCREAM FROSTING
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Desserts
      Yield: 6 servings
 
  2 1/2 c  Sifted cake flour OR
  2 1/3 c  Sifted all-purpose flour
      1 c  Sugar
      1 ts Baking soda
  1 1/2 ts Cinnamon
    3/4 ts Nutmeg
    3/4 ts Cloves
      1 ts Salt
      1 c  Brown sugar
    2/3 c  Shortening
      1 c  Buttermilk
      3    Eggs
 
  Grease and flour 2-9" layer cake pans or one 13x9" oblong pan.  Sift
  flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves and salt
  together.  Add the brown sugar, shortening and buttermilk.  Beat 2
  minutes.  Add eggs. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Bake layer pans for
  30 to 35 minutes, oblong pan 45 minutes until cake tests done.  Cool.
  Frost.
  
  MAPLE BUTTERCREAM FROSTING:
  
  1/2    cup    Crisco shortening (regular only)
  1/2    cup    butter, softened
  1      tsp.   maple flavoring (like vanilla extract)
  4      cups   (1 lb.) powdered sugar
  2      Tbsp.  milk
  
  Cream butter and shortening.  Add maple flavoring. Gradually add
  powdered sugar.  Gradually add milk and continue beating until light
  and airy.  Add more milk if needed.  Color with paste colors.
  
  This icing is a light yellow and colors you add will be affected by
  this. For pure white icing, use 1 cup regular Crisco shortening and
  1/2 tsp. Wilton butter flavoring. This icing is somewhat stiffer.
  For blazing white, add Wilton White White. Wilton White White will
  also make the first buttercream recipe whiter, but be careful with
  colors as they will still tend to be yellowish.
  
  Note:  Excellent cake and frosting!
  
  Cake from the old '50's Betty Crocker Cookbook Frosting from ??
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: MICROWAVE PEANUT BRITTLE
 Categories: Microwave, Candies, Desserts, Holiday
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 c  Sugar
    1/2 c  White corn syrup
      1 c  Peanuts, roasted and salted
      1 ts Butter
      1 ts Vanilla
      1 ts Baking soda
 
  In a 1 1/2 qt. microwaveable casserole dish, stir together sugar and
  corn syrup.  Microwave on high for 4 minutes.  Meanwhile, lightly
  grease a cookie sheet (can also use an unbuttered non-stick coated
  cookie sheet). Stir in peanuts and microwave on high for another 4
  minutes, until light brown. Add butter and vanilla to syrup, blending
  well. Microwave on high 1 minute 45 seconds more. Peanuts will be
  lightly browned and syrup VERY hot. Add baking soda and gently stir
  until light and foamy. Pour mixture quickly onto prepared cookie
  sheet.  Let cool 1 hour.  When cool, break into small pieces and
  store in an airtight container.
  
  Cleanup isn't as bad as it looks!  Once casserole dish has cooled,
  fill with water and add all utensils used in preparation. Let soak a
  short while and the candy will all dissolve away!
  
  From:  General Electric Microwave Cookbook Posted by:  Debbie Carlson
  ~ Cooking Echo Makes:  Approximately 1 lb.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: CHRISTMAS GINGER COOKIES
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Holiday
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      6 c  Flour
      1 tb Baking soda
      1 tb Ginger
      1 ts Cloves
      1 ts Cinnamon
      1 ts Nutmeg
    1/2 ts Salt
      1 c  Solid shortening, Crisco
      1 c  Molasses
      1 c  Brown sugar, packed
    1/2 c  Water
      1 lg Egg
    1/2 ts Vanilla
 
  Mix flour, soda, spices and salt.
  
  Beat shortening, molasses, sugar, water, egg and vanilla until well
  blended. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Will be soft. Divide into
  fourths.  Pat each 1/4 into 1" thick round. Wrap in plastic and
  refrigerate at least 3 hours or up to 1 week.
  
  Roll on lightly floured surface to 1/8" thick, cut with gingermen
  cutters and bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes.  Cool slightly on
  cookie sheet, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
  Decorate with Royal Icing.
  
  ROYAL ICING:
  
  3       cups    confectioners sugar 1/4 tsp cream of tartar 2 large
  egg whites food colors
  
  In large bowl, mix all ingredients until stiff.  Color and use to
  decorate cookies.
  
  Note:  GREAT RECIPE!  Makes a lot of cookies.  Dough is easy to
  handle and can be made ahead.
  
  From:  Linda Glover - Cooking Echo
  
  Posted by:  Debbie Carlson
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: FIVE POUND FUDGE
 Categories: Candies, Holiday, Oldies, Chocolate
      Yield: 6 servings
 
  4 1/2 c  Sugar
     12 oz Can evaporated milk
    1/4 lb Butter
      1    Jar marshmallow creme
     12 oz Semi-sweet chocolate chips
     12 oz Milk chocolate bar
      2 c  Chopped pecans or walnuts
      2 ts Vanilla
 
  Cook sugar, milk, and butter to soft ball stage (234 degrees on candy
  thermometer), stirring constantly.  Take off the heat and add the
  remaining ingredients.  Stir quickly and thoroughly to blend.  Pour
  into a large baking pan or dish (I lightly butter it first).  Cool.
  Cut into squares and store in refrigerator.
  
  My favorite fudge recipe!!
  
  From:  Jackie Olden's Newsletter
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: LINDA'S NUT CRUNCH
 Categories: Candies, Desserts, Chocolate
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      2 c  Butter
      2 c  Sugar
      6 tb Water
     10 oz Slivered almonds
     12 oz Semi-sweet chocolate chips
      1 c  Walnuts, chopped
 
  In electric skillet, melt butter.  Add sugar, almonds and water.
  Place candy thermometer into mix.  Temperature of skillet should be
  about 400 degrees.  Cook, stirring constantly to hard/crack stage on
  thermometer. Pour mix quickly onto a large jelly roll sheet (large
  cookie sheet with sides). Spread very quickly. Cool in refrigerator.
  Melt chocolate chips over double boiler. Spread over cooled candy and
  sprinkle walnuts while chocolate is still soft.  Press nuts into
  chocolate to secure. Cool again. Break into pieces and store in an
  airtight container.
  
  From:  Linda Rehberg, courtesy Debbie Carlson - Cooking Echo Makes:
  4 lbs.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: CHEESECAKE CUPCAKES
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Desserts, Cheese/eggs
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      8 oz Cream cheese, softened
      2    Eggs
    3/4 c  Sugar
      1 tb Lemon juice
      1 ts Vanilla
     18    To 24 vanilla wafers
      1 c  Sour cream
      2 tb Sugar
      1 ts Vanilla
 
  Whip together the cream cheese and 3/4 cup sugar.  Add the eggs, lemon
  juice and vanilla. Using foil liners only in muffin tin (don't use
  paper or paper inserts!), put 1 vanilla wafer in bottom of each
  liner. Put in 2 Tbsp. of cream cheese mixture on top of wafer in each
  liner. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 15-20 minutes. Center
  will sink a little when taken out of oven.
  
  Meanwhile, blend together sour cream, 2 Tbsp. sugar and 1 tsp.
  vanilla in a bowl.  Top baked "cupcakes" with this sour cream blend.
  Or, instead of using the sour cream blend, can top with cherry pie
  filling, other types of filling or grated chocolate.  Refrigerate.
  
  Note:  My "cupcakes" actually needed to bake about 30 minutes.  I
  doubled this recipe and came out with exactly 36 cupcakes.  I used
  one can of blueberry pie filling and the sour cream recipe above as
  is.  But, on the cupcakes I used the sour cream on, after letting
  them cool for 15 minutes, I put the sour cream on and popped them
  back in the oven for 5 minutes. The ones I used the fruit on, I let
  them cool for 15 minutes before topping them. - Debbie
  
  Makes:  18 From: Jean Paluso Posted by: Debbie Carlson
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: HELEN'S CHEESECAKE
 Categories: Cheese/eggs, Desserts, Pie/tart, Cake/cookie
      Yield: 6 servings
 
MMMMM---------------------------CRUST--------------------------------
    3/4 c  Pecans, coarsely ground
    3/4 c  Graham crackers, crushed
           (or boxed graham cracker
           -crumbs)
      3 tb Unsalted butter, melted
           Mazola no-stick spray

MMMMM--------------------------FILLING-------------------------------
      8 oz Cream cheese, at room
           -temperature
      4    Eggs
  1 1/4 c  Sugar
      1 tb Fresh lemon juice
      2 ts Vanilla

MMMMM--------------------------TOPPING-------------------------------
      2 c  Sour cream
    1/4 c  Sugar
      1 ts Vanilla
 
  Crust:  Mix ground pecans, crushed graham cracker crumbs and butter
  together.  Press onto bottom of a 9" or 10" springform pan that has
  been sprayed generously with Mazzola No-Stick spray.  Set aside.
  
  Filling:  Preheat oven at 350 degrees.  Beat cream cheese in a large
  bowl with an electric mixer until smooth.  Add eggs, 1 1/4 cups
  sugar, lemon juice and 2 tsp. vanilla.  Beat thoroughly.  Spoon over
  crust. Set pan on baking sheet.  Bake 9" pan for 50-55 minutes or 10"
  pan for 40-45 minutes at 350 degrees. Remove from oven and let stand
  at room temperature for 15 minutes (leave oven on).
  
  Topping:  While cheesecake is baking, combine sour cream, 1/4 cup
  sugar and 1 tsp. vanilla.  Blend well.  Cover and refrigerate.  Once
  cake has stood at room temperature for 15 minutes, spread topping
  over. Return to oven and bake 5 minutes longer.  Let cool thoroughly
  then refrigerate for at least 24 hours or preferably 2 to 3 days.
  Remove from pan and enjoy!
  
  ***This recipe comes from an old Supervisor of mine (Helen).  She
  used this recipe to sell her cheesecakes professionally.  It appears
  rather basic but is a huge hit with any cheesecake officianado!  We
  used to have raffles as fundraisers for this cheesecake.***
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: MOPPING SAUCE FOR BARBECUE
 Categories: Salsa/sauce, Bbq/grill, Tex/mexican, Beverages
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 c  Strong black coffee
    1/2 c  Worcestershire sauce
      1 c  Tomato catsup
    1/4 c  Butter
      1 tb Freshly ground black pepper
      1 tb Sugar
      1 tb Salt
 
  Combine all ingredients and simmer 30 minutes.  Stir frequently.
  Store in a tightly covered jar in refrigerator until needed. Heat
  gently before using*.  This is wonderful, too, for oven roasts of
  pork, etc.
  
  [*Note:  We add about half a can of beer at this point.  K.B.]
  
  From:  THE WIDE, WIDE WORLD OF TEXAS COOKING by Morton G. Clark,
  Bonanza Books, New York. 1970.  LCC# 70-99574 Posted by: Karin
  Brewer, Cooking Echo, 12/92

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Strawberry Rhubarb Coffee Cake
 Categories: Desserts, Beverages, Cake/cookie, Fruit
      Yield: 16 servings
 
MMMMM--------------------------FILLING-------------------------------
      3 c  Sliced fresh or frozen
           -rhubarb, 1 inch pieces
      1 qt Fresh strawberries, mashed
      2 tb Lemon juice
      1 c  Sugar
    1/3 c  Cornstarch

MMMMM----------------------------CAKE---------------------------------
      3 c  All-purpose flour
      1 c  Sugar
      1 ts Baking powder
      1 ts Baking soda
    1/2 ts Salt
      1 c  Butter or margarine, cut
           -into pieces
  1 1/2 c  Buttermilk
      2    Eggs
      1 ts Vanilla extract

MMMMM--------------------------TOPPING-------------------------------
    1/4 c  Butter or margarine
    3/4 c  All-purpose flour
    3/4 c  Sugar
 
  In a large saucepan combine rhubarb, strawberries and lemon juice.
  Cover and cook over medium heat about 5 minutes. Combine sugar and
  cornstarch; stir into saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly
  until thickened; remove from heat and set aside.
  
  In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and
  salt. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Beat
  buttermilk, eggs and vanilla; stir into crumb mixture. Spread half of
  the batter evenly into a greased 13" x 9" x 2" baking dish. Carefully
  spread filling on top. drop remaining batter by tablespoonfuls over
  filling.
  
  For topping: Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Remove from
  heat; stir in flour and sugar until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
  Sprinkle over batter. Lay foil on lower rack to catch any juicy fruit
  spillovers. Bake at 350 degrees, for 40-45 minutes. Cool in pan. Cut
  into squares. Yield: 16-20 servings.
  
  SOURCE: *Dorothy Morehouse, Massena, NY, Country Woman Magazine
  Mar/Apr 93 POSTED BY: Jim Bodle 5/93
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Broccoli-Rice Casserole
 Categories: Casseroles, Vegetables
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 ea Jo Ferry
      1 c  Minute Rice; uncooked
      8 oz Cheese Whiz***
    1/2 c  Celery; chopped
    1/4 c  Onion; chopped
      1 pk Chopped broccoli; thawed
    1/2 c  Milk
      1 cn Cream of chicken soup
 
  ***You can substitute 1 can cheddar cheese soup. Mix everything
  together in a casserole dish and bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 45
  minutes.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Wild Rice and Broccoli
 Categories: Rice, Vegetables
      Yield: 6 servings
 
    3/4 c  Wild rice
      1 c  Sliced celery
      2    10 oz packages frozen
           -broccoli spears, cooked
      3 tb Butter
      3 tb Flour
    1/4 ts Salt
      1    Chicken bouillon cube,
           -crushed
      2 c  Milk
    1/2 c  Parmesan cheese, divided
      1 tb Lemon juice
 
  Cook rice; stir in celery.  Spoon mixture into a greased, shallow, 2
  quart casserole.  Arrange broccoli over rice mixture.  In a small
  saucepan, melt butter, add flour, salt, and bouillon. Gradually add
  milk, stirring constantly until mixture becomes thick and smooth.
  Stir in 1/4 cup cheese and lemon juice. Pour over broccoli. Sprinkle
  with remaining cheese. Bake at 375 F for 20 minutes.
